title: Netflix Now Lets You Subscribe From IPhone, iPad Apps
text:
Get Business & Technology Alerts 
26 Sep 2015 05:08 AM EST 
Netflix updated its apps for Apple iOS devices to let users subscribe to the service directly from their iPhones or iPads, announcing the feature with an assist from two stars of its popular original series “Orange Is the New Black.” The No. 1 streaming service first launched iOS apps in 2010, but until now required customers to already have signed up on the web. Other streaming services, including Hulu and HBO Now, already provide in-app purchasing from Apple devices. To be sure, the change isn’t likely to result in a major lift in Netflix subscriber signups. If anything, it’s an acknowledgement of the rapid rise of mobile-video viewing, and the fact that smartphones and tablets are the primary screen for entertainment among a growing mass of people.
